reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was looking for a hotel in Madrid that was close to a Metro station and located in a safe and quiet neighborhood. I found both with this wonderful hotel. The hotel was business like and a joy to stay in. The Metro was right down the street and the neighborhood was gorgeous. The staff was courteous at check in and check out. The hotel is not flashy but not a drag to stay in either. The room was about average size for Europe, AC worked, and the room service was quick and painless.
reviews.title: Loved It, Would Stay Again

likes.liked: — It's location and closeness to the Metro station
likes.disliked: — The expensive breakfast and thin walls.

reviews.text: The only two reasons I did not rate this hotel as excellent was because of their lack of complimentary breakfast and the room's thin walls. The breakfast was downright expensive with a price of 10 euros per person. The thin walls didn't bother me until we had our neighbor jabbering throughout the whole night one of our nights there. Other than that I loved it and would most definately stay there if visiting Madrid again. I'll just make sure to find breakfast elsewhere next time.
reviews.title: good location and friendly receptionists

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed here 1 night only last week. Very close to Metro station but not that obvious when you come up from the underground. Two very friendly receptionists (both male) on duty when I arrived. Room was spacious and air conditioning worked well. Bathroom average size with reasonable toiletries. Note that the lift starts from a level above ground so one has to climb about 8 or 10 steps before getting into lift for bedrooms levels.
reviews.title: Quiet yet fairly central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast (which I didnt realise was not included in my rate) was about 11 euro and was disappointing in the quality. The room itself was lacking in atmosphere and had a 'canteen' feel to it. Overall however fine for a one night stay.
reviews.title: Good, clean, excellent location

reviews.text: Lovely hotel in central location. Less than 5 minutes walk to the nearest metro station and from there the whole city is accessible. Alternatively you can walk to some very lively spots with great bars and nightlife. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. The room was good and clean with a very comfortable bed. Very little noise in this area of the city so we had no problems getting a good nights sleep. Would definitely use this hotel again.
reviews.title: Great service, but the amenities could improve
Hotel Reviews are accurate except for construction noise
reviews.text: Stayed at the Gran Versalles beginning Dec 12 for six nights. The location is good via the subway (50 yards). Staying in the Sol or Gran Via area would have been much more convenient and but probably more costly (excellent subway system).

reviews.title: One of Madrid's best hotels
reviews.text: The room was very clean with good service throughout. We were able to check in by mid morning. The room was very warm at times as a little bit of heat was still being generated even though the thermostat was off.

reviews.title: Recommend!
reviews.text: The major complaint is the construction project precisely next door. Continued loud noise from 8am through 6pm. The construction has been ongoing for months. The hotel should post a warning of this construction noise on its web site.

reviews.title: Clean and cool in the hot city
reviews.text: Hopefully this review will push this hotel up the charts a bit more, as it was well worth it. We came here on an Expedia deal (the first time I used them) for 2 nights @ 150 euros and found it to be well worth the money. As folks pointed out before about the helpful staff, we found them to be helpful beyond the call. The porter, who gave us advice about a club we were visiting and who also made phonecalls to make sure it was open, the very friendly front desk gentlemen who gave you the feeling they were happy you chose their hotel and even correcting a spelling mistake on our postcards!

The location is fantastic - the Alonso Martinez metro station is a great hub for going anywhere in the city and we were a short walk away from the Plaza Colon and the Paseo De La Castelleano, where the 12 October parade was being held (The Hard Rock Cafe is also there and a few minutes more walking and you're in the shops arround Serrano and Goya stations). If you want a hotel, this is the one you have to choose.
reviews.title: Very good value, well located, friendly staff
Lovely hotel.
reviews.text: The Gran Versalles is a lovely hotel just off the main road with little traffic passing so not too much noise to deal with (besides Spanish taxi drivers at the front of the building). The hotel is adequately located just away from the major tourist attractions but this is not a problem as the Metro system in Madrid is top class and will get you anywhere you want to go easily and cheaply. The rooms were clean and nicely put together (the maid who cleaned our room every day was hot aswell!). The staff were very helpful and spoke very good English so no hassle checking-in or answering our queries. My only gripe is the bar. It was very small and very very standard. But atleast it was clean and the barman was very polite and friendly and saw to all our alcoholic needs.

reviews.title: Everything we could have asked for
reviews.text: My mother and I stayed in this hotel for a week during a vacation to Madrid. The staff was very accomodating. After checking in, the staff remembered our names and greeted us like friends every time we entered or left the hotel. We were quite impressed with this as the hotel was sold out most of the nights we were there. We went to Barcelona for two nights and only wanted to take over night bags and the hotel was more than happy to store our bags for us 'til we returned to Madrid. Our room was very very clean when we arrived and was well cleaned every day. As other reviewers mentioned, the walls were thin and we were right by the elevator so we were aware that people we around us but by no means was the noise disturbing to our stay. I would stay here again on another trip to Madrid.

reviews.title: Tucked away
reviews.text: My wife and I were very satisfied with our stay. We arrived jet lagged and found the staff helpful and responsive. Breakfast had a nice spread of hot and cold foods. We had a French Tour group staying with us so the dinning area was packed. We did the European thing, asked if we could join someones table. (This is appalling to Americans) The Hotel is very safe inside as outside walking home at Midnight. We didn't bother with the Metro even though we had a stop close by. You can walk to most places of interst without fanfare. I use crutches by the way...... We did take a cab on suggestion of the Hotel to a Bus station and it was reasonable 5 Euro cross town. Within 8 city blocks we had a Tony Roma's, Hard Rock Cafe, Sub Way and Burger King. For some this can be handy since the Spanards eat late. Tony Roma's for example closes at 2 PM and opens back up at 8:30PM. We ate the local food which is excellent. I would stay in this Hotel again.

reviews.title: Nice centrally located hotel
reviews.text: Nice hotel, centrally located about 50-100 metres from Alonso Martinez Metro. Rooms brightly decorated but rather warm (in Feb) air-con didn't seem to be working. Evening bar rather impersonal, very bright lights but tapas served with the drinks. Friendly staff. Overall very good value for money would definitely consider staying there again if in Madrid

reviews.title: Central Location
reviews.text: Nice clean hotel, Staff very helpful, centrally located so that a short walk takes you to most tourists sites worth seeing.
The hotel is at best location in Madrid, near Alonso Martinez and plaza Colon.
reviews.title: Best location and price

reviews.text: Staff was very friendly and we got best last minute rate at the hotel website.
reviews.title: noisy, noisy
Ok, but some significant failings
reviews.text: It is 4star although it should be only 3.
I will go back to the hotel whenever I return to Madrid.
